title: How to Beat Rito in the Pool Party Challenge (Image Tutorial)
body:
So, as a community, we're not doing all that well on getting points for the Pool Party contest right now.

I figured out from speaking to others in-game, a LOT of people don't know about chat room functions in the client, so here's a basic tutorial for such, in 4 simple steps.

_**STEP 1**_

Locate the following area of your LoL client (bottom right corner) and click on the middle icon. This is the chat room tab. 


http://i.imgur.com/JNS4AlS.png

Type in "Pool Party" and hit the magnifying glass symbol to join. It'll most likely be full. 

http://i.imgur.com/zyZ8hTu.png

What do? Chat rooms are 200 people max, so join the next one. "Pool Party 1" "Pool Party 2" etc. As many as we need. If you're the only person in the room, just chill out and wait. More will join if the others are full.

_**STEP 2**_

Start a game. Don't be a nab and click solo queue. Hit the Party button. In the following menu, locate the most important button you'll see for the next 4 days.

http://i.imgur.com/3YJudNM.png

_**STEP 3**_

Click that glorious button. It'll take you to another screen.

http://i.imgur.com/wUPw0uT.png

The handy-dandy "Chat Rooms" tab at the bottom is a very, very dear ally for beating Rito. Click it, spam click the + signs until your 15 invites is full, then invite them. Repeat as needed, being sure to not invite the same person twice.

_**STEP 4**_

When your room finally looks like this. 

http://i.imgur.com/4RjuYqW.png

Hit the start button. You've done it. Congratulations. Win or lose, you've helped to add five points toward our fight against Rito. Win one match like this and you're eligible for the rewards. If every player who plays LoL in a month does this until they win one game, we'll rek Rito's meter and blow it ~~through the roof~~ _out of the water_. Get on it, people.

His comment was very FACETIOUS. Any person who has read a book in the past year can tell because he starts off with an exclamation point. From that alone you can tell that his comment was said with an upbeat irony. Almost every instance where a statement starts with an exclamation is facetious or dramatic. A comment beginning with an exclamation and ending with no punctuation...

Satire - A literary technique of writing or art which principally ridicules its subject often as an intended means of provoking or preventing change. Humour is often used to aid this.

Sarcasm - "A form of humor that is marked by bitter mockery, often using _**irony**_, and sometimes conveyed in _**over-emphasis. **_"

- Dictionary.com

Sarcasm and satire are not mutually exclusive as ironic satire is a separate entity altogether. I cry for the reading comprehension and humor on these boards that they would take this seriously.
